   17: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   18: %% @author Maxim Fedorov <maximfca@gmail.com>
   19: %% Basic process tracing profiler tests.
   20: -module(tprof_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server callbacks
   24: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   25:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: %% Test cases exports
   28: -export([
   29:     call_count_ad_hoc/0, call_count_ad_hoc/1,
   30:     call_time_ad_hoc/0, call_time_ad_hoc/1,
   31:     call_memory_ad_hoc/0, call_memory_ad_hoc/1,
   32:     lists_seq_loop/1, call_memory_total/1,
   33:     sort/0, sort/1,
   34:     rootset/0, rootset/1,
   35:     set_on_spawn/0, set_on_spawn/1, seq/1,
   36:     live_trace/0, live_trace/1,
   37:     patterns/0, patterns/1, pattern_fun/1, pattern_fun/2, pattern_fun/3,
   38:     processes/0, processes/1,
   39:     server/0, server/1,
   40:     hierarchy/0, hierarchy/1,
   41:     code_reload/0, code_reload/1,
   42:     code_load/0, code_load/1
   43: ]).
   44: 
   45: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   46: 
   47: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   48: %% COMMON TEST CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   49: 
   50: suite() ->
   51:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   52: 
   53: all() ->
   54:     [{group, all}].
   55: 
   56: groups() ->
   57:     [{all, [parallel], [call_count_ad_hoc, call_time_ad_hoc, call_memory_ad_hoc,
   58:                         call_memory_total, sort, rootset, set_on_spawn,
   59:                         code_load, code_reload,
   60:                         {group, default_session},
   61:                         {group, custom_session}]},
   62:      {default_session,[],session()},
   63:      {custom_session,[parallel],session()}].
   64: 
   65: init_per_group(custom_session, Config) ->
   66:     [{session, ?MODULE} | Config];
   67: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: session() ->
   74:     [live_trace, patterns, processes, server, hierarchy].
   75: 
   76: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   77: %% TEST CASES
   78: 
   79: call_count_ad_hoc() ->
   80:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_count measurement"}].
   81: 
   82: call_count_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   83:     ct:capture_start(),
   84:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16]),
   85:     ct:capture_stop(),
   86:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
   87:     %% expect one line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3    5   [  ...]",
   88:     true =
   89:         lists:any(
   90:             fun
   91:                 ("lists:seq_loop/3" ++ Rest) ->
   92:                     [_, "[", _] = string:lexemes(Rest, " "),
   93:                     true;
   94:                 (_) ->
   95:                     false
   96:             end,
   97:             Output
   98:         ),
   99:     %% spawn examples
  100:     SpawnFun =
  101:         fun () ->
  102:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  103:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  104:        end,
  105:     %% trace subset examples
  106:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_count}),
  107:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  108:     %% timer
  109:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  110:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  111:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count,
  112:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  113:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile2).
  114: 
  115: call_time_ad_hoc() ->
  116:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_time measurement"}].
  117: 
  118: call_time_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  119:     ct:capture_start(),
  120:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_time}),
  121:     ct:capture_stop(),
  122:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  123:     %% expect one line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3    5   ...   ...  [...]",
  124:     true =
  125:         lists:any(
  126:             fun
  127:                 ("lists:seq_loop/3" ++ Rest) ->
  128:                     ["5", _, _, "[" ++ _ | _] = string:lexemes(Rest, " "),
  129:                     true;
  130:                 (_) ->
  131:                     false
  132:             end,
  133:             Output
  134:         ),
  135:     %% spawn examples
  136:     SpawnFun =
  137:         fun () ->
  138:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  139:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  140:        end,
  141:     %% trace subset examples
  142:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_time}),
  143:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  144:     %% timer
  145:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  146:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  147:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time,
  148:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  149:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile2).
  150: 
  151: call_memory_ad_hoc() ->
  152:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_memory measurement"}].
  153: 
  154: call_memory_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  155:     ct:capture_start(),
  156:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_memory}),
  157:     ct:capture_stop(),
  158:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  159:     %% expect third line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3   5     32   6.40  [...]",
  160:     ?assertMatch(["lists:seq_loop/3", "5", "32", _, "[" ++ _ | _], string:lexemes(lists:nth(3, Output), " ")),
  161:     %% spawn examples
  162:     SpawnFun =
  163:         fun () ->
  164:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  165:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  166:        end,
  167:     %% trace subset examples
  168:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  169:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile1),
  170:     %% timer
  171:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  172:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  173:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  174:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile2).
  175: 
  176: lists_seq_loop(N) ->
  177:     [int_to_bin_twice(M) || M <- lists:seq(1, N)].
  178: 
  179: int_to_bin_twice(M) ->
  180:     B = integer_to_binary(M),
  181:     <<B/binary, B/binary>>.
  182: 
  183: %% Ensure total is not truncated,
  184: %% as per https://github.com/erlang/otp/issues/8139
  185: call_memory_total(_Config) ->
  186:     ct:capture_start(),
  187:     ok = tprof:profile(?MODULE, lists_seq_loop, [10000], #{type => call_memory}),
  188:     ct:capture_stop(),
  189:     ?assertNotMatch(nomatch, string:find(ct:capture_get(), " 150000 ")),
  190:     ok.
  191: 
  192: sort() ->
  193:     [{doc, "Tests sorting methods work"}].
  194: 
  195: sort(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  196:     %% sort examples
  197:     ct:capture_start(),
  198:     ok = tprof:profile(
  199:         fun () ->
  200:             Group = lists:seq(100, 120),
  201:             rand:uniform(hd(Group))
  202:         end, #{report => {process, {measurement_per_call, descending}}, type => call_memory}),
  203:     ct:capture_stop(),
  204:     Out = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  205:     %% measurement per call is 5th column
  206:     Col = 5,
  207:     Column5 = [string:to_integer(lists:nth(Col, Lexemes)) || Ln <- Out,
  208:         length(Lexemes = string:lexemes(Ln, " ")) >= Col],
  209:     WPC = [Words || {Words, []} <- Column5],
  210:     %% ensure descending sort
  211:     ?assertEqual(lists:reverse(lists:sort(WPC)), WPC).
  212: 
  213: rootset() ->
  214:     [{doc, "Tests rootset of processes supplied to ad-hoc profiler"}].
  215: 
  216: rootset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  217:     TestCase = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  218:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(TestCase),
  219:     Fun = fun () -> ok = pg:join(TestCase, lists:seq(1, 2), self()) end,
  220:     %% rootset tests
  221:     {ok, Profile} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => [TestCase], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  222:     TwoProcs = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  223:     ?assertEqual(2, maps:size(TwoProcs)), %% must be pg and "profiled process"
  224:     %% now trace all processes, existing and new
  225:     {ok, ProfAll} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => all, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  226:     %% at least tprof, pg2 and new profiled processes are traced
  227:     ?assert(map_size(tprof:inspect(ProfAll)) >= 3),
  228:     gen_server:stop(Scope).
  229: 
  230: set_on_spawn() ->
  231:     [{doc, "Tests tprof running with extra spawned processes"}].
  232: 
  233: set_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  234:     %% profile a function that spawns additional process
  235:     {done, Profile} = tprof:profile(
  236:         fun () ->
  237:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  238:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  239:         end, #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  240:     {done, ProfileMFA} = tprof:profile(?MODULE, seq, [32], #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  241:     %% check totals
  242:     #{all := {call_memory, _G1, TotalProfile}} = tprof:inspect(Profile, total, measurement),
  243:     #{all := {call_memory, _G2, TotalProfileMFA}} = tprof:inspect(ProfileMFA, total, measurement),
  244:     %% only 1 process must be there
  245:     ?assertEqual(1, maps:size(tprof:inspect(Profile)), {set_on_spawn, Profile}),
  246:     %% check per-process stats
  247:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  248:         8 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, 9, 9.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile));
  249:         4 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, 10, 10.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile))
  250:     end,
  251:     %% MFA takes 6 more words. This test should be improved to depend less on the internal
  252:     %%  implementation.
  253:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  254:         8 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, 13, 13.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA));
  255:         4 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, 14, 14.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA))
  256:     end.
  257: 
  258: seq(Max) ->
  259:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, Max) end),
  260:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end.
  261: 
  262: live_trace() ->
  263:     [{doc, "Tests memory tracing for pre-existing processes"}].
  264: 
  265: live_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  266:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  267:     Pid = spawn_link(
  268:         fun () ->
  269:             receive
  270:                 {From, C} ->
  271:                     [lists:seq(1, 2) || _ <- lists:seq(1, C)],
  272:                     From ! {self(), done}
  273:             end
  274:         end),
  275:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  276:     1 = enable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  277:     Pid ! {self(), 12},
  278:     receive {Pid, done} -> ok end,
  279:     catch disable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  280:     Profile = collect(Config, Srv),
  281:     ProcInspected = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  282:     %% white box check: list comprehension with 1-arity, and 100% allocation
  283:     %% tprof:format(user, ProcInspected),
  284:     #{Pid := {call_memory, 48, [{?MODULE, {_LC, 1}, 13, 48, _, 100.0}]}} = ProcInspected,
  285:     stop(Config, Srv).
  286: 
  287: patterns() ->
  288:     [{doc, "Tests pattern enable/disable correctness"}].
  289: 
  290: patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  291:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  292:     %% test errors
  293:     ?assertEqual({error, {not_traced, pg, get_members, '_'}}, clear_pattern(Config, Srv, pg, get_members, '_')),
  294:     ?assertEqual({error, {trace_pattern, ?MODULE, seq, 2}}, set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 2)),
  295:     %% successful patterns
  296:     1 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  297:     3 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  298:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2),
  299:     Expected = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  300:     ?assertEqual(#{?MODULE => Expected}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  301:     %% verify tracing flags
  302:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Expected], [{?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2}]),
  303:     %% trace the entire ?MODULE module, and then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  304:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  305:     3 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  306:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  307:     Cleared = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 2}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  308:     Traced = ?MODULE:module_info(functions) -- Cleared,
  309:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Cleared]),
  310:     %% clear all, which clears lists too
  311:     _ = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  312:     verify_trace(Srv, [], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced ++ Cleared]),
  313:     ?assertEqual(#{}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  314: 
  315:     %% Trace the entire node then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  316:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  317:     ?assertEqual(all, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  318: 
  319:     stop(Config, Srv).
  320: 
  321: verify_trace(Srv, On, Off) ->
  322:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, []}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- On],
  323:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, false}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- Off].
  324: 
  325: pattern_fun(Any) -> Any.
  326: pattern_fun(Any, Any2) -> {Any, Any2}.
  327: pattern_fun(Any, Any2, Any3) -> {Any, Any2, Any3}.
  328: 
  329: processes() ->
  330:     [{doc, "Tests that process management for enabling/disabling traces works"}].
  331: 
  332: processes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  333: 
  334:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config),
  335: 
  336:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  337:     Pid2 = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  338:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  339:     register(Name, Pid2),
  340:     %% test a mix of pids/registered processes/single PID calls
  341:     ?assertEqual(2, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, Name])),
  342:     ?assertEqual(0, disable_trace(Config, Srv, '$sure_not_exist')),
  343:     ?assertEqual({1, ['$sure_not_exist']}, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, '$sure_not_exist'])),
  344:     ok = gen:stop(Pid),
  345:     ok = gen:stop(Name),
  346: 
  347:     stop(Config, Srv).
  348: 
  349: server() ->
  350:     [{doc, "Tests for gen_server-based API"}].
  351: 
  352: server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  353:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  354: 
  355:     %% start an extra pg scope - we'll trace it during profiling
  356:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(Name),
  357:     %% simulate existing process
  358:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  359:     %% start the profiler
  360:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  361:     %% test that ad-hoc profile can be run
  362:     ?assertEqual(ok, tprof:profile(fun() -> lists:seq(1,10) end)),
  363:     %% test live trace
  364:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, dispatch, '_'),
  365:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(pg, '_', '_'),
  366:     %% watch for pg traces and for our process
  367:     2 = tprof:enable_trace([Pid, Name]),
  368:     %% run the traced operation
  369:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  370:     %% collect profile (can save it to a file for later analysis)
  371:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  372:     %% must not be empty, and must contain 3-words dispatch from this module,
  373:     %%  and at least something from pg in two processes
  374:     ?assertNotEqual([], FirstProfile),
  375:     ?assertEqual({?MODULE, dispatch, 2, [{Pid, 1, 3}]}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, FirstProfile)),
  376:     ?assertMatch({pg, handle_call, 3, [{Scope, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, FirstProfile)),
  377:     ?assertMatch({pg, join, 3, [{Pid, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(join, 2, FirstProfile)),
  378:     %% pause tracing
  379:     ok = tprof:pause(),
  380:     %% ensure paused by running more code but keeping the trace
  381:     %% ensure collection still returns the previous result
  382:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  383:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  384:     %% continue, ensure new results are collected
  385:     ok = tprof:continue(),
  386:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, leave, [Name, group, [Pid, Pid]]}),
  387:     ?assertNotEqual({call_memory, FirstProfile}, tprof:collect()),
  388:     %% restart all counters from zero and ensure that we again collect the original data
  389:     ok = tprof:restart(),
  390:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  391:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  392: 
  393:     %% test ad-hoc profiling can be done while running server-aided
  394:     %% for that, profiler should have very specific pattern
  395:     {_, AdHoc} = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 32], #{registered => false, pattern => {lists, '_', '_'},
  396:         report => return, type => call_memory}),
  397:     %% check totals: must be 64 words allocated by a single lists:seq_loop
  398:     ?assertMatch(#{all := {call_memory, 64, [{lists, _, _, 64, _, _}]}},
  399:                  tprof:inspect(AdHoc, total, measurement)),
  400:     %% verify that server-aided version still works
  401:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  402:     ok = tprof:stop(),
  403:     ok = gen_server:stop(Scope),
  404:     ok = gen:stop(Pid).
  405: 
  406: %% nano-gen-server purely for tracing
  407: spawn_loop() ->
  408:     receive
  409:         {'$gen_call', From, Call} ->
  410:             dispatch(Call, From),
  411:             spawn_loop();
  412:         {system, From, {terminate,normal}} ->
  413:             gen:reply(From, ok)
  414:     end.
  415: 
  416: dispatch({spawn_link, Fun}, From) ->
  417:     gen:reply(From, erlang:spawn_link(Fun));
  418: dispatch({apply, M, F, A}, From) ->
  419:     gen:reply(From, erlang:apply(M, F, A)).
  420: 
  421: hierarchy() ->
  422:     [{doc, "Tests tracing for process hierarchy"}].
  423: 
  424: hierarchy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  426:     Traced = enable_trace(Config, Srv, {all_children, kernel_sup}),
  427:     ?assert(Traced > 5),
  428:     ?assert(set_pattern(Config, Srv, code_server, '_', '_') > 5),
  429:     _ = code:get_path(), %% makes a call to code_server
  430:     %% disabling all processes tracing should return more than "children of"
  431:     ?assert(disable_trace(Config, Srv, all) > Traced),
  432:     {call_memory, Profile} = collect(Config, Srv),
  433:     stop(Config, Srv),
  434:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, Profile)).
  435: 
  436: code_reload() ->
  437:     [{doc, "Tests that collection does not fail for a hot-code-reloaded module"}].
  438: 
  439: code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  440:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} = tprof:profile(
  441:                                    fun () -> msacc:start(100), code:load_file(msacc) end,
  442:                                    #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  443:     %% don't care about actual returned values, but do care that profile/2 does not crash
  444:     ?assertNotEqual([], Sample).
  445: 
  446: code_load() ->
  447:     [{doc, "Tests profiling works for modules loaded during profiling"}].
  448: 
  449: code_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  450:     code:purge(sofs),
  451:     code:delete(sofs),
  452:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} =
  453:         tprof:profile(fun () -> sofs:relation([{b,1},{c,2},{c,3}]) end,
  454:                       #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  455:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(sofs, 1, Sample)).
  456: 
  457: -define(SESSION(A, B),
  458:         case proplists:get_value(session, Config) of
  459:             undefined ->
  460:                 A;
  461:             _Session ->
  462:                 B
  463:         end).
  464: 
  465: start_link(Config) ->
  466:     ?SESSION(
  467:        tprof:start_link(),
  468:        tprof:start_link(#{ session => _Session })).
  469: 
  470: start_link(Config, Opts) ->
  471:     ?SESSION(
  472:        tprof:start_link(Opts),
  473:        tprof:start_link(Opts#{ session => _Session })).
  474: 
  475: set_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  476:     ?SESSION(
  477:        tprof:set_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  478:        tprof:set_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  479:       ).
  480: 
  481: clear_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  482:     ?SESSION(
  483:        tprof:clear_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  484:        tprof:clear_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  485:       ).
  486: 
  487: enable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  488:     ?SESSION(
  489:        tprof:enable_trace(Spec),
  490:        tprof:enable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  491:       ).
  492: 
  493: disable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  494:     ?SESSION(
  495:        tprof:disable_trace(Spec),
  496:        tprof:disable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  497:       ).
  498: 
  499: collect(Config, Srv) ->
  500:     ?SESSION(
  501:        tprof:collect(),
  502:        tprof:collect(Srv)
  503:       ).
  504: 
  505: get_trace_map(Config, Srv) ->
  506:     ?SESSION(
  507:        tprof:get_trace_map(),
  508:        tprof:get_trace_map(Srv)
  509:       ).
  510: 
  511: stop(Config, Srv) ->
  512:     ?SESSION(
  513:        tprof:stop(),
  514:        tprof:stop(Srv)
  515:       ).
  516: 
  517: random_name(Prefix) ->
  518:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Prefix) ++ "__" ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer())).
  519:
